item.title: Report E-2025020275
item.description:
Report E-2025020275

  • State: MI

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was unloading and the vent fitting on the underground storage tank started to leak. Upon further inspection, the vent fitting was broken and the load was immediately stopped. Speedway was notified that the vent fitting on the tank was broken.

item.title: Report I-2025020040
item.description:
Report I-2025020040

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-01T21:20:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: Harbor Beach
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was unloading for 20-25 min with no leaks. Driver was in the front of truck doing paperwork when he heard sodium hydroxide start leaking. He realized his blowdown valve was open and shut it to stop the leak. No exposure injuries 100% of the 5-20 gallon spill went into containment.

item.title: Report I-2025020059
item.description:
Report I-2025020059

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-01T21:20:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: Monroe
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was loading spent ferrous chloride from the top and the hose came out of the trailer and fell to the ground causing about a 15 gallon loss of containment. Driver noticed that the hose had come out and quickly shut down the line. No Exposure or injures, site notified and cleaned up the spill. 100% in containment
